info.title: Sysdig Secure API
info.description:
Sysdig Secure RESTful Documentation

## Conventions
### Access | Send | Receive
API access is over HTTPS and accessed from:


SaaS: See [SaaS Regions](https://docs.sysdig.com/en/saas-regions-and-ip-ranges.html) and IP Ranges for the URLs corresponding to different regions.


For example:
Sysdig Secure for US East: https://secure.sysdig.com

Sysdig Monitor for US West: https://us2.app.sysdig.com

Sysdig Secure for EU Central: https://eu1.app.sysdig.com/secure/

Sysdig Monitor for EU Central: https://eu1.app.sysdig.com

On-Prem: through your Sysdig application server address


Data is sent and received using `JSON` format.

### Authorization
The Sysdig API token must be passed to the HTTPS server via the Authorization header with the format:

`Authorization: Bearer [token]`

### Encoding
The request should set the HTTP header:

`Accept: application/json`

Every response is returned with the HTTP header

`Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8`

To reduce the size of the request and (primarily) the response, you can set the header to compress HTTP body and response:

`Accept-Encoding:gzip, deflate, sdch`

<SecurityDefinitions />

get.summary: Check status of overview service.
get.description: Checks whether the overview service is available or not.

200.description: Successfully returned status of overview service.

401.description: Status Unauthorized: Returned when user is not authorized

403.description: Status Forbidden: Returned when Overview V2 is disabled

x-codeSamples.source:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/secure/overview/status"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request GET \
  --url https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/secure/overview/status

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.get("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/secure/overview/status")
  .asString();

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("secure.sysdig.com")

conn.request("GET", "/api/v1/secure/overview/status")

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

get.summary: Datasource for the Secure Overview page.
get.description: Fetches overview data for a specified set of panels of the Secure Overview page. Customer ID is derived from API key.

parameters.name: panel
parameters.description: Comma seperated string of panel(s) for which to fetch metrics. Defaults to all panels if omitted.

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description: Type of data to return. Either instant (Donut graphs) or range (Trend graphs). Defaults to both if omitted. If range data is included, a constant timeframe will be returned for all range data in the response, with a length of 90 days, or the number of days since customer creation, whichever is smaller.

parameters.name: cluster
parameters.description: Cluster name (Applies to runtimeScanResults and runtimeCveSeverity). Can be set to `non-k8s` to get data not associated with a kubernetes cluster (e.g. locally run Docker images. Omit to include all data (both k8s and non-k8s)

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace name (Applies to runtimeScanResults and runtimeCveSeverity). Only available if `cluster` is set and valid. Omit to include all namespaces.

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"

)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/secure/overview?panel=SOME_STRING_VALUE&timeframe=SOME_STRING_VALUE&cluster=SOME_STRING_VALUE&namespace=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	defer res.Body.Close()

}

curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/secure/overview?panel=SOME_STRING_VALUE&timeframe=SOME_STRING_VALUE&cluster=SOME_STRING_VALUE&namespace=SOME_STRING_VALUE'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.get("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/secure/overview?panel=SOME_STRING_VALUE&timeframe=SOME_STRING_VALUE&cluster=SOME_STRING_VALUE&namespace=SOME_STRING_VALUE")
  .asString();

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("secure.sysdig.com")

conn.request("GET", "/api/v1/secure/overview?panel=SOME_STRING_VALUE&timeframe=SOME_STRING_VALUE&cluster=SOME_STRING_VALUE&namespace=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

get.summary: Status
get.description: Checks the availability of the Benchmarks V2 API. If Benchmarks V2 is disabled for the customer, and no Cloud Benchmark results are available, this endpoint will return a 403. If Benchmarks V2 is disabled for the customer, but Cloud Benchmark results are available, this endpoint will return 200 with a dummy TaskId in the response body to be used to request the Cloud Benchmark results. Finally, if Benchmark V2 is enabled, this endpoint will return a 200 with no body.

dummyCloudTaskId.description: This task Id is not a real task, but is used to request Cloud Benchmark results. If there are no Cloud Benchmark results available, this endpoint will return a `403 STATUS FORBIDDEN` instead.

403.description: Status Forbidden: Returned when Benchmarks V2 is disabled, and there are no Cloud Benchmark Results available. FE should hide the Benchmarks V2 UI.

get.summary: Scope Options
get.description: Returns the list of available Scope Labels and Operators that can be used when creating a Benchmark Task. If an optional 'schema' query param is provided, only Scope Labels relevant to that schema are returned, otherwise all possible Scope Labels are returned.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: Fetch the Scope Labels and Operators for this schema. Use a value returned from `/benchmarks/v2/schemas`

labels.description: A list of supported Scope Labels

operators.description: A list of supported Scope Operators

controls.title: Ensure that the API server pod specification file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
Ensure that the API server pod specification file ownership is set to root:root
Ensure that the --anonymous-auth argument is set to false
Ensure that the --basic-auth-file argument is not set

x-codeSamples.source:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/benchmarks/v2/tasks"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"name\":\"Kube-bench Production\",\"schedule\":\"0 9 * * 1\",\"schema\":\"kube_bench_cis-1.5\",\"scope\":\"kubernetes.cluster.name=\\\"production\\\"\\n\",\"enabled\":false,\"excludeControlList\":[\"1.1.1.a\",\"1.2.2\"]}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request POST \
  --url https://secure.sysdig.com/api/benchmarks/v2/tasks \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"name":"Kube-bench Production","schedule":"0 9 * * 1","schema":"kube_bench_cis-1.5","scope":"kubernetes.cluster.name=\"production\"\n","enabled":false,"excludeControlList":["1.1.1.a","1.2.2"]}'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.post("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/benchmarks/v2/tasks")
  .header("content-type", "application/json")
  .body("{\"name\":\"Kube-bench Production\",\"schedule\":\"0 9 * * 1\",\"schema\":\"kube_bench_cis-1.5\",\"scope\":\"kubernetes.cluster.name=\\\"production\\\"\\n\",\"enabled\":false,\"excludeControlList\":[\"1.1.1.a\",\"1.2.2\"]}")
  .asString();

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("secure.sysdig.com")

payload = "{\"name\":\"Kube-bench Production\",\"schedule\":\"0 9 * * 1\",\"schema\":\"kube_bench_cis-1.5\",\"scope\":\"kubernetes.cluster.name=\\\"production\\\"\\n\",\"enabled\":false,\"excludeControlList\":[\"1.1.1.a\",\"1.2.2\"]}"

headers = { 'content-type': "application/json" }

conn.request("POST", "/api/benchmarks/v2/tasks", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

countLabel.description: Controls if counts.resources or counts.controls is displayed in the UI. Must be either 'resources' or 'counts'

otherResultByAccount.description: A map with keys corresponding to AWS Account Ids

additionalProperties.description: A map with keys corresponding to AWS Regions

labels.description: A key value map of labels and their values.

title.example: Ensure no Network ACLs allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to remote server administration ports

description.example: The Network Access Control List (NACL) function provide stateless filtering of ingress and egress network traffic to AWS resources. It is recommended that no NACL allows unrestricted ingress access to remote server administration ports, such as SSH to port 22 and RDP to port 3389.

rationale.example: Public access to remote server administration ports, such as 22 and 3389, increases resource attack surface and unnecessarily raises the risk of resource compromise.

remediation.example: increases resource attack surface and unnecessarily raises the risk of resource compromise.

get.summary: Get the complete compliance report for a given compliance standard.
get.description: Fetches the complete compliance report for a given compliance standard and environment.

parameters.name: standard
parameters.description: The compliance standard to be queried.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: The environemnt to be queried for a given standard.

parameters.name: cluster
parameters.description: The cluster name scope for a given compliance standard.

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description: To fetch the long form description of every control in the compliance report

parameters.name: showBulkFail
parameters.description: To be used to determine whether to show bulk failures

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: To filter the results by status=FAIL/PASS/WARN

200.description: Successfully returned the complete compliance report for a given compliance standard and environment.

pass.description: Total number of passing controls for the entire compliance report

fail.description: Total number of failing controls for the entire compliance report

warn.description: Total number of controls in warn state for the entire compliance report

unchecked.description: Total number of controls not checked by Sysdig for the entire compliance report

checkedTotal.description: Total number of controls checked by Sysdig for the entire compliance report

pass.description: Total number of passing controls for the compliance family

total.description: Total number of controls for the compliance family

name.description: The name / heading of the given compliance family under a compliance section
name.example: Do not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters

name.description: Name of a single compliance control per standard

id.description: The control id / number of the given control

rationale.description: The explanation of what the checks are for a given control from Sysdig POV. This will be empty when detail=false
rationale.example: Sysdig has falco policies that can be enabled to detect a particular scenario

description.description: The long form detailed description of a given control. This will be empty when detail=false
description.example: Long form decsription

url.description: The full url to view the proof / remediation action for a given control

text.description: The link text that is to be displayed for a proof/remediation url

description.description: The description of what the link / activity is
description.example: Schedule a CIS Benchmark to run on your infrastructure

url.description: The full url to view the proof / remediation action for a given control

text.description: The link text that is to be displayed for a proof/remediation url

description.description: The description of what the link / activity is
description.example: Schedule a CIS Benchmark to run on your infrastructure

action.description: The short action text for the type of remediation recommended

name.description: Name of the control
name.example: Enable only necessary services, protocols and daemons.

id.description: Control id / number

404.description: The compliance info could not be found.

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/compliance/v2/scope/metadata"

package main

import (
	"fmt"

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/compliance/v2/tasks"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"name\":\"Kube-bench Production\",\"schedule\":\"0 9 * * 1\",\"schema\":\"kube_bench_cis-1.5\",\"scope\":\"kubernetes.cluster.name=\\\"production\\\"\\n\",\"framework\":\"SOC2\",\"platform\":\"WORKLOAD\",\"version\":\"Latest\",\"enabled\":false,\"excludeControlList\":[\"1.1.1.a\",\"1.2.2\"]}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

  .asString();

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the schedule was defined the first time

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the schedule was last updated

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/reporting/v1/scanning/schedules"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"name\":\"Weekly vulnerability report\",\"description\":\"Weekly report for package vulnerabilities fount in the Production environment.\\nRequired for compliance needs.\\n\",\"reportType\":\"vulnerabilities\",\"configuration\":{\"scope\":{\"imageId\":\"sha256:b6fa739cedf5ea12a620a439402b6004d057da800f91c7524b5086a5e4749c9f\",\"runtimeEnabled\":true,\"runtimeScope\":\"string\",\"registry\":\"docker.io\",\"repository\":\"debian\",\"tag\":\"stable\"},\"queryFilters\":{\"vulnType\":{\"value\":\"os\"},\"fixAvailable\":{\"value\":false},\"severity\":{\"value\":\"high\",\"comparison\":\">=\"}},\"columns\":[\"vulnId\",\"severity\",\"package\"],\"sorting\":[{\"column\":\"vulnId\",\"sortOrder\":\"asc\"}]},\"schedule\":\"0 9 * * 1\",\"enabled\":true,\"notificationChannels\":[{\"notificationChannelId\":12456,\"format\":\"csv\"}],\"onDemandGenerationEnabled\":false}")

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/networkTopology/ownerTopology?namespace=SOME_STRING_VALUE&cluster=SOME_STRING_VALUE&name=SOME_STRING_VALUE&kind=SOME_STRING_VALUE&from=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&to=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/networkTopology/ownerTopology?namespace=SOME_STRING_VALUE&cluster=SOME_STRING_VALUE&name=SOME_STRING_VALUE&kind=SOME_STRING_VALUE&from=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&to=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.get("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/networkTopology/ownerTopology?namespace=SOME_STRING_VALUE&cluster=SOME_STRING_VALUE&name=SOME_STRING_VALUE&kind=SOME_STRING_VALUE&from=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&to=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE")
  .asString();

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("secure.sysdig.com")

conn.request("GET", "/api/v1/networkTopology/ownerTopology?namespace=SOME_STRING_VALUE&cluster=SOME_STRING_VALUE&name=SOME_STRING_VALUE&kind=SOME_STRING_VALUE&from=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&to=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE")

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

post.summary: Creates a Kubernetes Network Policy
post.description: Creates a Kubernetes Network Policy

parameters.name: namespaceName
parameters.description: The name of a kubernetes namespace

ingress.description: List of ingress rules to be applied to the selected pods

from.description: List of sources which should be able to access the pods selected for this rule

ipBlock.description: Defines policy on a particular IPBlock

except.description: CIDRs that should not be included within an IP Block

items.description: a CIDR

namespaceSelector.description: Matches all pods in all namespaces selected by this label selector

matchExpressions.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: Represents a key's relationship to a set of values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty.

matchLabels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

podSelector.description: Selects all matching pods in the namespace

matchExpressions.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: Represents a key's relationship to a set of values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty.

matchLabels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

ports.description: List of ports which should be made accessible on the pods selected for this rule

protocol.description: The protocol by which traffic must match. Defaults to TCP if not specified. In the future UDP and SCTP may be supported.

egress.description: List of egress rules to be applied to the selected pods

to.description: List of destinations for outgoing traffic of pods selected for this rule

except.description: CIDRs that should not be included within an IP Block

items.description: a CIDR

matchLabels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/networkSecurity/namespaces/%7BnamespaceName%7D/simulatedPolicies"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"spec\":{\"ingress\":[{\"from\":[{\"ipBlock\":{\"cidr\":\"192.168.1.1/24\",\"except\":[\"192.168.1.1/24\"]},\"namespaceSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}},\"podSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}}}],\"ports\":[{\"port\":0,\"protocol\":\"TCP\"}]}],\"egress\":[{\"to\":[{\"ipBlock\":{\"cidr\":\"192.168.1.1/24\",\"except\":[\"192.168.1.1/24\"]},\"namespaceSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}},\"podSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}}}],\"ports\":[{\"port\":0,\"protocol\":\"TCP\"}]}],\"podSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}},\"policyTypes\":[\"Ingress\"]}}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request POST \
  --url https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/networkSecurity/namespaces/%7BnamespaceName%7D/simulatedPolicies \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"spec":{"ingress":[{"from":[{"ipBlock":{"cidr":"192.168.1.1/24","except":["192.168.1.1/24"]},"namespaceSelector":{"matchExpressions":[{"key":"string","operator":"In","values":["string"]}],"matchLabels":{}},"podSelector":{"matchExpressions":[{"key":"string","operator":"In","values":["string"]}],"matchLabels":{}}}],"ports":[{"port":0,"protocol":"TCP"}]}],"egress":[{"to":[{"ipBlock":{"cidr":"192.168.1.1/24","except":["192.168.1.1/24"]},"namespaceSelector":{"matchExpressions":[{"key":"string","operator":"In","values":["string"]}],"matchLabels":{}},"podSelector":{"matchExpressions":[{"key":"string","operator":"In","values":["string"]}],"matchLabels":{}}}],"ports":[{"port":0,"protocol":"TCP"}]}],"podSelector":{"matchExpressions":[{"key":"string","operator":"In","values":["string"]}],"matchLabels":{}},"policyTypes":["Ingress"]}}'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.post("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/networkSecurity/namespaces/%7BnamespaceName%7D/simulatedPolicies")
  .header("content-type", "application/json")
  .body("{\"spec\":{\"ingress\":[{\"from\":[{\"ipBlock\":{\"cidr\":\"192.168.1.1/24\",\"except\":[\"192.168.1.1/24\"]},\"namespaceSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}},\"podSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}}}],\"ports\":[{\"port\":0,\"protocol\":\"TCP\"}]}],\"egress\":[{\"to\":[{\"ipBlock\":{\"cidr\":\"192.168.1.1/24\",\"except\":[\"192.168.1.1/24\"]},\"namespaceSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}},\"podSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}}}],\"ports\":[{\"port\":0,\"protocol\":\"TCP\"}]}],\"podSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}},\"policyTypes\":[\"Ingress\"]}}")
  .asString();

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("secure.sysdig.com")

payload = "{\"spec\":{\"ingress\":[{\"from\":[{\"ipBlock\":{\"cidr\":\"192.168.1.1/24\",\"except\":[\"192.168.1.1/24\"]},\"namespaceSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}},\"podSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}}}],\"ports\":[{\"port\":0,\"protocol\":\"TCP\"}]}],\"egress\":[{\"to\":[{\"ipBlock\":{\"cidr\":\"192.168.1.1/24\",\"except\":[\"192.168.1.1/24\"]},\"namespaceSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}},\"podSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}}}],\"ports\":[{\"port\":0,\"protocol\":\"TCP\"}]}],\"podSelector\":{\"matchExpressions\":[{\"key\":\"string\",\"operator\":\"In\",\"values\":[\"string\"]}],\"matchLabels\":{}},\"policyTypes\":[\"Ingress\"]}}"

headers = { 'content-type': "application/json" }

conn.request("POST", "/api/v1/networkSecurity/namespaces/%7BnamespaceName%7D/simulatedPolicies", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

An enum of ways to order a sorted collection of values

parameters.description: Unix time of when to start looking for captures in microseconds

parameters.description: Unix time of when to stop looking for captures in microseconds

schema.description: An enum of Sysdig products

parameters.description: Limit the results to only captures matching a scope expression

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Uniquely identifies a capture and correlates the capture to a request. Must match the following regex ([a-z0-9]){8}-([a-z0-9]){4}-([a-z0-9]){4}-([a-z0-9]){4}-([a-z0-9]){12}

schema.description: A list of captures and associated metadata

total.description: Indicates how many captures would have been returned if no limit query param was specified. It does not represent the number of captures returned in the request.

allOf.description: Metadata to create a capture

name.description: A way to reference a capture. Must not be empty

duration.description: The range in time from when the capture began to when it ended in seconds. The maximum value is 86400

containerId.description: Uniquely identifies a container

bucketName.description: The name of the s3 bucket to which the capture will be saved. May be null

folder.description: The name of a folder in an s3 bucket

filters.description: A way to only capture a subset of the data

agent.description: Describes a Sysdig agent running on a machine

customer.description: The ID of a particular customer

id.description: Uniquely identifies an agent

hostName.description: The name of the host the agent is running on

allOf.description: Contains system calls and other operating system events

id.description: uniquely identifies the capture

maxSize.description: The maximum number of bytes allowed to be in this capture

pastDuration.description: The range in time from when the capture began to when the event that triggered the capture occurred in seconds. The maximum value is 86400

pastSize.description: The amount of bytes in the capture that occurred in the pastDuration interval

dateRequested.description: The unix timestamp of when the capture was requested in milliseconds

dateReceived.description: The unx timestamp of when the Sysdig backend received the capture from the agent in milliseconds

downloadUrl.description: The url to download the capture

size.description: The number of bytes in the capture

type.description: An enum of the different types of storage to which captures can be saved

status.description: An enum of the different statuses a capture can have

accessKey.description: The key that allows an agent to communicate with a collector

bytesReceived.description: The number of bytes the Sysdig backend has received from the agent

bytesStored.description: The number of bytes the Sysdig backend has pushed to a storage provider

token.description: Uniquely identifies a capture and correlates the capture to a request. Must match the following regex ([a-z0-9]){8}-([a-z0-9]){4}-([a-z0-9]){4}-([a-z0-9]){4}-([a-z0-9]){12}

storageId.description: Uniquely identifies a storage configuration

scope.description: A scope expression that limits where the capture could have been taken

offset.description: Indicates the distance between the true starting point and the index of the first returned capture. Corresponds to the offset query param that was provided in the original request.

canLoadMore.description: Indicates whether the number of captures returned had some limit applied

schema.description: Details on why the request was invalid

accessKey.description: The key that allows an agent to communicate with a collector

bytesReceived.description: The number of bytes the Sysdig backend has received from the agent

bytesStored.description: The number of bytes the Sysdig backend has pushed to a storage provider

token.description: Uniquely identifies a capture and correlates the capture to a request. Must match the following regex ([a-z0-9]){8}-([a-z0-9]){4}-([a-z0-9]){4}-([a-z0-9]){4}-([a-z0-9]){12}

storageId.description: Uniquely identifies a storage configuration

scope.description: A scope expression that limits where the capture could have been taken

400.description: Indicates the request body was invalid

schema.description: Details on why the request was invalid

message.description: Explains why the request was rejected
message.example: Value for parameter 'dir' is not supported

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/captures/%7BcaptureId%7D"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"source\":\"sdc\",\"name\":\"my_capture.scap\",\"duration\":30,\"containerId\":\"8883164eb9bf\",\"bucketName\":\"string\",\"folder\":\"/\",\"annotations\":{},\"filters\":\"proc.name=vi\",\"agent\":{\"customer\":0,\"id\":34688,\"machineId\":\"12:dd:fe:e0:17:0b\",\"hostName\":\"ip-10-2-157-201\",\"attributes\":{}},\"id\":1327048,\"maxSize\":104857600,\"pastDuration\":3,\"pastSize\":0,\"dateRequested\":1625783854265,\"dateReceived\":1625783881254,\"downloadUrl\":\"/api/v1/captures/1327048/download\",\"size\":87335540,\"type\":\"local\",\"status\":\"requested\",\"accessKey\":\"string\",\"bytesReceived\":87335540,\"bytesStored\":87335540,\"token\":\"960d9da0-cc79-4079-932a-544e193ab385\",\"metrics\":[\"string\"],\"storageId\":153,\"scope\":\"host.hostName = 'ip-10-2-157-201'\",\"machineId\":\"12:dd:fe:e0:17:0b\"}")

get.summary: Retrieve vulnerabilities data of an image

parameters.name: imageDigest
parameters.description: The targeted image digest

schema.description: an image digest string, starting with "sha256:" prefix

parameters.name: vtype
parameters.description: The type of vulnerabilities to retrieve

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: If specified, only vulnerabilities that contain this substring will be retrieved

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting method. Defaults to descendent.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Field used to alphabetically sort by. Defaults to severity.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of severities. If specified, only vulnerabilities of these severities will be retrieved

parameters.name: hasFix
parameters.description: If specified, only vulnerabilities with an available fix will be retrieved

parameters.name: cmpDigest
parameters.description: If specified, the vulnerabilities in the response will contain a comparison status relative to the image specified by this parameter. A total count of all comparison statuses will also be returned.

parameters.name: cmpFilter
parameters.description: If specified, only vulnerabilities matching this comparison status will be returned. If not specified, all vulnerabilities will be returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: If specified, a 0-based index on the vulnerabilities list. Only entries >= offset will be retrieved. Defaults to 0. If filter is also specified, this index will be applied on the filtered list. An empty list will be retrieved if this index overflows the list.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: If specified, a limit on the number of entries retrieved. If filter is also specified, the limit will be applied on the filtered list. limit must be >= 1 and if it overflows the list all entries will be retrieved.

parameters.name: includeVulnExceptions
parameters.description: If specified, returns also the set of vulnerability exception lists where the vulnerability is contained and when it will expire.

parameters.name: imageTag
parameters.description:
The image's tag.
Required when "includeVulnExceptions" is set to true.

parameters.name: bundleId
parameters.description: Target bundle. If not specified, the currently active bundle will be used.

sortBy.description: The field used to sort the result

hasFix.description: Wether only vulns with a fix have been retrieved

limit.description: The limit used. 0 for no limit.

canLoadMore.description: True if more results can be fetched.

new.description: The total count of new vulnerabilities.

fixed.description: The total count of fixed vulnerabilities.

shared.description: The total count of shared vulnerabilities.

items.description: Vulnerability object plus comparison status.
nvd_data object

severity.description: The vulnerability severity level

url.description: URL to full description of the vulnerability

vulnexceptions.description: List of vulnExceptions by id/name along with the vulnerability expiration for that exception list

expires.description:
The timestamp till the vulnerability will be disabled. If `null`, the entry never expires.

**Note**: the actual expiration will be computed only once a day for the entire Sysdig installation.
The task will be executed each day at 0:00 UTC (4:00 PM PST, 5:00 PM PDT) and will consider
expiration dates which are <= than the current **date**.

parameters.description: If specified, a limit on the number of entries retrieved. If filter is also specified, the limit will be applied on the filtered list. limit must be >= 1 and if it overflows the list all entries will be retrieved.

parameters.name: includeVulnExceptions
parameters.description: If specified, returns also the set of vulnerability exception lists where the vulnerability is contained and when it will expire.

parameters.name: imageTag
parameters.description:
The image's tag.
Required when "includeVulnExceptions" is set to true.

parameters.name: bundleId
parameters.description: Target bundle. If not specified, the currently active bundle will be used.

sortBy.description: The field used to sort the result

hasFix.description: Wether only vulns with a fix have been retrieved

limit.description: The limit used. 0 for no limit.

canLoadMore.description: True if more results can be fetched.

new.description: The total count of new vulnerabilities.

fixed.description: The total count of fixed vulnerabilities.

shared.description: The total count of shared vulnerabilities.

items.description: Vulnerability object plus comparison status.
nvd_data object

severity.description: The vulnerability severity level

url.description: URL to full description of the vulnerability

vulnexceptions.description: List of vulnExceptions by id/name along with the vulnerability expiration for that exception list

expires.description:
The timestamp till the vulnerability will be disabled. If `null`, the entry never expires.

**Note**: the actual expiration will be computed only once a day for the entire Sysdig installation.
The task will be executed each day at 0:00 UTC (4:00 PM PST, 5:00 PM PDT) and will consider
expiration dates which are <= than the current **date**.

get.summary: Retrieve the vulnerability exception lists that this image is bound to via policies assignements [Digest]

parameters.name: imageDigest
parameters.description: The targeted image digest

schema.description: an image digest string, starting with "sha256:" prefix

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The image's tag

parameters.name: withItems
parameters.description: Include or not "items" in the response. Useful when there are a lot of vulnerability exception lists.

id.description: Unique identifier associated with this vulnerability exception list. It's created backend side.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the vulnerability exception list has been created

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the vulnerability exception list has been updated

name.description: The name of the vulnerability exception list.

version.description: Version of the vulnerability exception list. Should be "1_0"

items.description: An array of vulnerability exception items (while creating/updating a list, new item IDs will be created backend side)

id.description: The vulnerability identifier. Computed server side

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the vulnerability has been added to the exception list

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the vulnerability has been modified in one of its fields.

description.example:
There is a few bytes out-of-bounds read vulnerability in some Huawei products.
The software reads data past the end of the intended buffer when parsing certain message,
an authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted messages to the device.
Successful exploit may cause service abnormal in specific scenario.
Affected product versions include:AR120-S versions V200R007C00SPC900,V200R007C00SPCa00

notes.description: The user written notes attached to a specific vulnerability exception item

expiration_date.description:
The timestamp till the vulnerability will be disabled. If `null`, the entry never expires.

**Note**: the actual expiration will be computed only once a day for the entire Sysdig installation.
The task will be executed each day at 0:00 UTC (4:00 PM PST, 5:00 PM PDT) and will consider
expiration dates which are <= than the current **date**.

enabled.description:
Enable/disable vulnerability when considering exceptions.
Useful, in combination with `expiration_date` to handle temporary exceptions.

policyBundleId.description: An policy bundle ID. While retrieving this object, this is the bundle ID that contains this vulnerability exception list. While inserting/updating, this is the target bundle, and if not specified, the currently active bundle will be used.

404.description: Image digest not found

nStops.description: Number of stop rules triggered from this gate/trigger pair

nWarns.description: Number of warn rules triggered from this gate/trigger pair

Repo_Tag.description: The name of the image that triggered this rule.

Trigger_Id.description: The trigger identifier responsible for this rule output.

Check_Output.description: Human-readable output string of this rule.

Whitelisted.description: Whether this rule was whitelisted in the policy.

Policy_Id.description: The ID of the policy that contains the triggered rule.

rows.description: the list of outputs for this pair/gate trigger

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/scanning/v1/policies"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"id\":\"string\",\"comment\":\"string\",\"name\":\"string\",\"version\":\"string\",\"isDefault\":true,\"rules\":[{}],\"policyBundleId\":\"string\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request POST \
  --url https://secure.sysdig.com/api/scanning/v1/policies \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"id":"string","comment":"string","name":"string","version":"string","isDefault":true,"rules":[{}],"policyBundleId":"string"}'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.post("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/scanning/v1/policies")
  .header("content-type", "application/json")
  .body("{\"id\":\"string\",\"comment\":\"string\",\"name\":\"string\",\"version\":\"string\",\"isDefault\":true,\"rules\":[{}],\"policyBundleId\":\"string\"}")
  .asString();

import http.client

payload = "{\"id\":\"string\",\"comment\":\"string\",\"name\":\"string\",\"version\":\"string\",\"isDefault\":true,\"rules\":[{}],\"policyBundleId\":\"string\"}"

headers = { 'content-type': "application/json" }

conn.request("POST", "/api/scanning/v1/policies", payload, headers)

data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

get.summary: Retrieve all the vulnerability exception lists in the targeted policy bundle

parameters.name: bundleId
parameters.description: Target bundle. If not specified, the currently active bundle will be used.

parameters.name: withItems
parameters.description: Include or not "items" in the response. Useful when there are a lot of vulnerability exception lists.

200.description: All the vulnerability exception lists in the targeted policy bundle

id.description: Unique identifier associated with this vulnerability exception list. It's created backend side.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the vulnerability exception list has been created

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the vulnerability exception list has been updated

name.description: The name of the vulnerability exception list.

version.description: Version of the vulnerability exception list. Should be "1_0"

items.description: An array of vulnerability exception items (while creating/updating a list, new item IDs will be created backend side)

id.description: The vulnerability identifier. Computed server side

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the vulnerability has been added to the exception list

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the vulnerability has been modified in one of its fields.

description.example:
There is a few bytes out-of-bounds read vulnerability in some Huawei products.
The software reads data past the end of the intended buffer when parsing certain message,
an authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted messages to the device.
Successful exploit may cause service abnormal in specific scenario.
Affected product versions include:AR120-S versions V200R007C00SPC900,V200R007C00SPCa00

notes.description: The user written notes attached to a specific vulnerability exception item

expiration_date.description:
The timestamp till the vulnerability will be disabled. If `null`, the entry never expires.

**Note**: the actual expiration will be computed only once a day for the entire Sysdig installation.
The task will be executed each day at 0:00 UTC (4:00 PM PST, 5:00 PM PDT) and will consider
expiration dates which are <= than the current **date**.

enabled.description:
Enable/disable vulnerability when considering exceptions.
Useful, in combination with `expiration_date` to handle temporary exceptions.

policyBundleId.description: An policy bundle ID. While retrieving this object, this is the bundle ID that contains this vulnerability exception list. While inserting/updating, this is the target bundle, and if not specified, the currently active bundle will be used.

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"

)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/scanning/v1/whitelists"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"comment\":\"string\",\"name\":\"string\",\"version\":\"string\",\"items\":[{\"id\":\"string\",\"createdAt\":1595433581,\"updatedAt\":1595433581,\"description\":\"There is a few bytes out-of-bounds read vulnerability in some Huawei products.\\nThe software reads data past the end of the intended buffer when parsing certain message,\\nan authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted messages to the device.\\nSuccessful exploit may cause service abnormal in specific scenario.\\nAffected product versions include:AR120-S versions V200R007C00SPC900,V200R007C00SPCa00\\n\",\"gate\":\"vulnerabilities\",\"trigger_id\":\"CVE-2020-9071+*\",\"notes\":\"string\",\"expiration_date\":1657622089,\"enabled\":true}]}")

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

get.summary: Retrieve the vulnerability exception list with the given id in the active policy bundle

parameters.name: bundleId
parameters.description: Target bundle. If not specified, the currently active bundle will be used.

200.description: The vulnerability exception list with the given id

id.description: Unique identifier associated with this vulnerability exception list. It's created backend side.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the vulnerability exception list has been created

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the vulnerability exception list has been updated

name.description: The name of the vulnerability exception list.

version.description: Version of the vulnerability exception list. Should be "1_0"

items.description: An array of vulnerability exception items (while creating/updating a list, new item IDs will be created backend side)

id.description: The vulnerability identifier. Computed server side

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the vulnerability has been added to the exception list

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the vulnerability has been modified in one of its fields.

description.example:
There is a few bytes out-of-bounds read vulnerability in some Huawei products.
The software reads data past the end of the intended buffer when parsing certain message,
an authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted messages to the device.
Successful exploit may cause service abnormal in specific scenario.
Affected product versions include:AR120-S versions V200R007C00SPC900,V200R007C00SPCa00

notes.description: The user written notes attached to a specific vulnerability exception item

expiration_date.description:
The timestamp till the vulnerability will be disabled. If `null`, the entry never expires.

**Note**: the actual expiration will be computed only once a day for the entire Sysdig installation.
The task will be executed each day at 0:00 UTC (4:00 PM PST, 5:00 PM PDT) and will consider
expiration dates which are <= than the current **date**.

enabled.description:
Enable/disable vulnerability when considering exceptions.
Useful, in combination with `expiration_date` to handle temporary exceptions.

policyBundleId.description: An policy bundle ID. While retrieving this object, this is the bundle ID that contains this vulnerability exception list. While inserting/updating, this is the target bundle, and if not specified, the currently active bundle will be used.

404.description: Vulnerability exception list not found

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/scanning/v1/vulnexceptions/%7Bid%7D?bundleId=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request GET \

conn.request("GET", "/api/scanning/v1/vulnexceptions/%7Bid%7D?bundleId=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

get.summary: Retrieve the list of all the scanning alerts

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of alerts in the response

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: An opaque string representing the current position in the list of alerts

alertId.description: Unique identifier associated with this alert. It's created backend side.

enabled.description: Whether this alert should actually be applied.

name.description: The name of the alert.

type.description: The type of the alert.

scope.description: An AND-composed string of predicates that selects the scope in which the alert will be applied. Only used when type=runtime.

repositories.description: The list of images for which the alert will be applied. Only used when type=repository.

unscanned.description: True if the alert should trigger for unscanned images. Only used when type=runtime.

analysis_update.description: True if the alert should trigger when a new image is analyzed. Only used when type=repository.

vuln_update.description: True if the alert should trigger if the set of vulnerabilities for an image changes.

policy_eval.description: True if the alert should trigger when the final result of the policy evaluation for a policy changes.

autoscan.description: True if the alert should automatically analyze unscanned images.

onlyPassFail.description: True if the policy_eval trigger should activate only when the result changes from pass to fail.

get.summary: Fetches all scanning results
get.description: Fetches all scanning results

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: If specified, only scan results that contain this substring will be retrieved

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting method. Defaults to descending.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Field used to alphabetically sort by. Defaults to scanDate.

parameters.name: registry
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of registry display names. If specified, only scan results from these registries will be retrieved

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: If specified, a 0-based index on the scan results list. Only entries >= offset will be retrieved. Defaults to 0. If filter is also specified, this index will be applied on the filtered list. An empty list will be retrieved if this index overflows the list.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: If specified, a limit on the number of entries retrieved. If filter is also specified, the limit will be applied on the filtered list. limit must be >= 1 and if it overflows the list all entries will be retrieved.

200.description: an array of scan results matching the provided filters.

filter.description: The string on which the results are to be filtered.

registry.description: A comma seperated list of registries to filter by

sortBy.description: The field used to sort the result

canLoadMore.description: True if more results can be fetched.

totalRows.description: The total number of images scanned

total.description: The total number of images scanned

totalFailed.description: The total number of images that are NOT pass the evaluation

totalPassed.description: The total number of images that are pass the evaluation

sysdig-cli.description: The total images that has this specific origin

sysdig-secure-ui.description: The total images that has this specific origin

sysdig-runtime-alert.description: The total images that has this specific origin

sysdig-inline-scanner.description: The total images that has this specific origin

sysdig-node-image-analyzer.description: The total images that has this specific origin

sysdig-admission-controller.description: The total images that has this specific origin

cicd-scan-request.description: The total images that has this specific origin

cicd-inline-scan.description: The total images that has this specific origin

aws-registry.description: The total images that has this specific origin

aws-fargate.description: The total images that has this specific origin

items.description: list of the all possible registry in all image scanned
list of the all possible origins in all image scanned

analyzedAt.description: The timestamp when analysis was comleted

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the analysis request was created

fullTag.description: The full tag of the image including registry, repository and tag

imageId.description: The image id

tagDetectedAt.description: The timestamp when tag was detected

registry.description: The image registry as derived from the fullTag

repository.description: The image repository as derived from the fullTag

tag.description: The image tag as derived from the fullTag

displayRegistry.description: The display name configured for the registry as derived from the fullTag

origin.description: The image origin

500.description: Internal server error, not due to request parameters

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/scanning/reporting/v2/schedules"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"name\":\"Weekly vulnerability report\",\"description\":\"Weekly report for package vulnerabilities fount in the Production environment.\\nRequired for compliance needs.\\n\",\"reportType\":\"vulnerabilities\",\"reportFormat\":\"csv\",\"filters\":{\"conditionFilters\":{\"packageType\":{\"value\":\"os\"},\"fixAvailable\":{\"value\":false},\"vulnSeverity\":{\"value\":\"high\",\"comparison\":\">=\"}},\"scopeFilter\":\"kubernetes.cluster.name in (\\\"prod\\\", \\\"stg\\\")\"},\"schedule\":\"00 09 * * *\",\"enabled\":true,\"notificationChannels\":[{\"id\":12456,\"type\":\"SLACK\"}]}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

get.summary: Retrieves a secure events feed
get.description:
Retrieves the list of events that match a filter given a specified
time range or cursor.
The pair `from` and `to` and the `cursor` parameter are mutually
exclusive. If you supply a `from` and `to` you must not supply a
`cursor` and vice-versa.
If you supply a `cursor` then the `prev` field inside the response is
set if and only if there are events before the first event returned, while
the `next` field inside the response is set if and only if there are
events after the last event returned. If, instead, you supply the `from`
and `to` pair then the `prev` and `next` fields inside the response are
always set, because in that case there is no efficient way for the backend
to verify if `next` and `prev` events actually exist. For this reason, the
best way to use this API is to supply the `from` and `to` pair at the
first request and then use the `prev` and `next` cursors to fetch events
before and after the events returned.
Please, do note that if you supply `from` and `to` and receive the `prev`
and `next` cursors, any subsequent request made by supplying that `next`
or `prev` cursor will return results that are not filtered by the `from`
and `to` you provided in the first request.
Finally, the difference between `from` and `to` cannot be greater than
2 weeks.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
From, expressed in nanoseconds. The difference between `from` and `to`
cannot be greater than 2 weeks.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
To, expressed in nanoseconds. The difference between `from` and `to`
cannot be greater than 2 weeks.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor is a string used to retrieve data given a specific context. The context can either be events feed before a certain event, after it or its surrounding. See the `prev`, `next` and `cursor` fields inside the response for further details.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Query language expression for filtering results. It is a subset of the
full metrics query language used in monitoring.

Operators:
- `and`, `or` and `not` logical operators (i.e. `pid = 1 and ppid = 2`)
- `=`, `!=`, `>`, `>=`, `<` and `<=` comparison operators (i.e. `pid = 1`)
- `in` to check inclusion in a list of values (i.e. `pid in (1, 2)` or
`clientipv4 in ("127.0.0.1", "192.168.0.1")`)

This query language does not support the full set of metrics supported
in the monitor query language, but instead supports a set of fields
proper to each audit events type.

The list of supported fields can be retrieved through the
`eventsFeedFilters` endpoint. In addition to those fields, also these
fields are supported:
- `severity` as numeric value in the `[0, 7]` range
- `category` as string value
- `originator` as string value (either  `policy` or `scanning`)
- `name` as string value
- `freeText` as string value
- `source` as string value
- `agentId` as numeric value
- `containerId` as string value
- `machineId` as string value
- `ruleName` as string value
- `ruleType` as numeric value
- `ruleSubType` as numeric value
- `policyId` as numeric value
- `alertName` as string value
- `trigger` as string value
- `image.id` as string value
- `image.registry` as string value
- `image.repo` as string value
- `image.tag` as string value
- `image.digest` as string value

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of events to return.

parameters.name: specialCategory
parameters.description:
How to handle special events categories, like the policy simulation
(advisor).
- `exclude_simulation` excludes events with category `simulation`
- `only_simulation` returns only events with category `simulation`

total.description:
The number of events returned. This number is always less or
equal the limit specified in the request.

prev.description:
The cursor that can be used to fetch a set of events before the
first event returned in the `data` array.
If this value is unset, then there are no events before the first
event returned in the `data` array.
By providing this value as `cursor` in a GET `secureEvents` request,
you will get the set of events that precede the first event returned
in the `data` array.

next.description:
The cursor that can be used to fetch a set of events after the last
event returned in the `data` array.
If this value is unset, then there are no events after the last
event returned  in the `data` array.
By providing this value as `cursor` in a GET `secureEvents` request,
you will get the set of events after the last event returned in the
`data` array.

id.description: The event id.

cursor.description:
The cursor that can be used to fetch a set of events surrounding
this same event. By providing this value as `cursor` in a GET
`secureEvents` request, you will get the set of events surrounding
this current event.

originator.description: Type of the event (i.e. policy, scanning etc.).

name.description: The event name.

description.example: Identify a container being created with privileged=true

severity.description: The event severity.

containerId.description: The container id.

oneOf.title: Capture
oneOf.description: Capture action performed once the event happened.

type.description: Capture action type.

successful.description: Whether or not the action was completed successfully.

errMsg.description: When `successful == false`, details on why the action failed.

token.description: Token that can be related to later messages.

afterEventNs.description: Period of time to capture after event in nanoseconds.

beforeEventNs.description: Period of time to capture before event in nanoseconds.

oneOf.title: Container paused
oneOf.description: Container paused action performed once the event happened.

type.description: Container paused action type.

successful.description: Whether or not the action was completed successfully.

errMsg.description: When `successful == false`, details on why the action failed.

token.description: Token that can be related to later messages.

oneOf.title: Container stopped
oneOf.description: Container stopped action performed once the event happened.

type.description: Container stopped action type.

successful.description: Whether or not the action was completed successfully.

errMsg.description: When `successful == false`, details on why the action failed.

token.description: Token that can be related to later messages.

oneOf.title: Container killed
oneOf.description: Container killed action performed once the event happened.

type.description: Action type.

successful.description: Whether or not the action was completed successfully.

errMsg.description: When `successful == false`, details on why the action failed.

token.description: Token that can be related to later messages.

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/secureEvents?from=1546300800000000000&to=1546300800000000000&cursor=LTltNGUybXIwdWkzZThhMjE1bjRn&filter=agent.id%3D1&limit=50&specialCategory=exclude_simulation"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/secureEvents?from=1546300800000000000&to=1546300800000000000&cursor=LTltNGUybXIwdWkzZThhMjE1bjRn&filter=agent.id%3D1&limit=50&specialCategory=exclude_simulation'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.get("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/secureEvents?from=1546300800000000000&to=1546300800000000000&cursor=LTltNGUybXIwdWkzZThhMjE1bjRn&filter=agent.id%3D1&limit=50&specialCategory=exclude_simulation")
  .asString();

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("secure.sysdig.com")

conn.request("GET", "/api/v1/secureEvents?from=1546300800000000000&to=1546300800000000000&cursor=LTltNGUybXIwdWkzZThhMjE1bjRn&filter=agent.id%3D1&limit=50&specialCategory=exclude_simulation")

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

get.summary: Verify presence of old events
get.description: Verify if there are new/legacy events in the store.

200.description: Whether or not there are new/legacy events.

hasLegacyEvents.description:
This is `true` if and only if there are no new events (i.e.
events in the new indices) in the time range from 30 days
ago to 29 days ago. This assumes that once the Secure Events
feature is deployed, all the events are written in the new
indices only; therefore, there are legacy events only if
there are no events in the new indices for that time range.

hasNewEvents.description:
This is `true` if and only if there is at least a new event
in the time range from 1 day ago to now.

500.description:
The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from
fulfilling the request.

message.description: The error message.

get.summary: Retrieves the count of scanning and policy events.
get.description: Retrieves the count of events that match a `filter` given a specified time range (`from <= to`). Parameters `from` and `to` are required.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
From, expressed in nanoseconds. The difference between `from` and `to`
cannot be greater than 2 weeks.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
To, expressed in nanoseconds. The difference between `from` and `to`
cannot be greater than 2 weeks.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Query language expression for filtering results. It is a subset of the
full metrics query language used in monitoring.

Operators:
- `and`, `or` and `not` logical operators (i.e. `pid = 1 and ppid = 2`)
- `=`, `!=`, `>`, `>=`, `<` and `<=` comparison operators (i.e. `pid = 1`)
- `in` to check inclusion in a list of values (i.e. `pid in (1, 2)` or
`clientipv4 in ("127.0.0.1", "192.168.0.1")`)

This query language does not support the full set of metrics supported
in the monitor query language, but instead supports a set of fields
proper to each audit events type.

The list of supported fields can be retrieved through the
`eventsFeedFilters` endpoint. In addition to those fields, also these
fields are supported:
- `severity` as numeric value in the `[0, 7]` range
- `category` as string value
- `originator` as string value (either  `policy` or `scanning`)
- `name` as string value
- `freeText` as string value
- `source` as string value
- `agentId` as numeric value
- `containerId` as string value
- `machineId` as string value
- `ruleName` as string value
- `ruleType` as numeric value
- `ruleSubType` as numeric value
- `policyId` as numeric value
- `alertName` as string value
- `trigger` as string value
- `image.id` as string value
- `image.registry` as string value
- `image.repo` as string value
- `image.tag` as string value
- `image.digest` as string value

200.description: The scanning and secure events count by severity.

countBySeverity.description: The count of events separatelly for each severity level.
The count of events separatelly for each severity level.
The count of events separately for each severity level.

400.description: The query parameters are missing or invalid

403.description: The provided access token is invalid

get.summary: Retrieve a summary of the audit events
get.description:
Retrieves a summary of the audit events in a time range grouped by a
series of metrics.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: From, expressed in nanoseconds.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: To, expressed in nanoseconds.

parameters.name: metric
parameters.description:
Metric used for aggregating results. The metric values are directly
fetched from the metadata service, so please refer to it for the full
list of supported metrics.

parameters.name: scopeFilter
parameters.description: Metrics query language expression for filtering results based on the scope. This filter is forwarded to the metadata service to scope down the number of results based on metrics attributes.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Query language expression for filtering results. It is a subset of the
full metrics query language used in monitoring.

Operators:
- `and`, `or` and `not` logical operators (i.e. `pid = 1 and ppid = 2`)
- `=`, `!=`, `>`, `>=`, `<` and `<=` comparison operators (i.e. `pid = 1`)
- `in` to check inclusion in a list of values (i.e. `pid in (1, 2)` or
`clientipv4 in ("127.0.0.1", "192.168.0.1")`)

This query language does not support the full set of metrics supported
in the monitor query language, but instead supports a set of fields
proper to each audit events type.

These are the supported fields:
- `id`
- `agentid`
- `auditid`
- `clientipv4`
- `clientport`
- `cmdline`
- `comm`
- `command`
- `containerid`
- `count`
- `customerid`
- `cwd`
- `direction`
- `errorcode`
- `l4protocol`
- `loginshell.distance`
- `loginshell.id`
- `name`
- `namespace`
- `pid`
- `ppid`
- `processname`
- `resource`
- `rxtimestamp`
- `serveripv4`
- `serverport`
- `sourceaddresses`
- `stages`
- `status`
- `subresource`
- `timestamp`
- `uid`
- `user`
- `useragent`

parameters.name: types
parameters.description:
The event types to filter. A comma separated list of one or more of 
the following supported values:
  - kubernetes
  - commands
  - connections
  - fileaccesses

parameters.name: segment
parameters.description:
Whether or not to segment the results with a distance between points
depending on the distance between `from` and `to`.

step.description:
If segmented data has been requested, the distance between points
in values expressed in nanoseconds.

command.description:
Series of tuples containing timestamp and values for a specific point in
time for the metric. Only present if there are elements matching the metric.

items.description:
The first element is always a timestamp expressed in
nanoseconds and the second one the metric value.

connection.description:
Series of tuples containing timestamp and values for a specific point in
time for the metric. Only present if there are elements matching the metric.

items.description:
The first element is always a timestamp expressed in
nanoseconds and the second one the metric value.

fileaccess.description:
Series of tuples containing timestamp and values for a specific point in
time for the metric. Only present if there are elements matching the metric.

items.description:
The first element is always a timestamp expressed in
nanoseconds and the second one the metric value.

kubernetes.description:
Series of tuples containing timestamp and values for a specific point in
time for the metric. Only present if there are elements matching the metric.

items.description:
The first element is always a timestamp expressed in
nanoseconds and the second one the metric value.

import (
	"fmt"

get.summary: Retrieves a list of audit events
get.description:
Retrieves a list of audit events in a time range filters.
The pair `from` and `to` and the `cursor` parameter are mutually
exclusive. If you supply a `from` and `to` you must not supply a
`cursor` and vice-versa.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: From, expressed in nanoseconds.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: To, expressed in nanoseconds.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor is a string used to retrieve data given a specific context. The context can either be audit events before a certain event, after it or its surrounding.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results to return.

parameters.name: scopeFilter
parameters.description: Metrics query language expression for filtering results based on the scope. This filter is forwarded to the metadata service to scope down the number of results based on metrics attributes.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Query language expression for filtering results. It is a subset of the
full metrics query language used in monitoring.

Operators:
- `and`, `or` and `not` logical operators (i.e. `pid = 1 and ppid = 2`)
- `=`, `!=`, `>`, `>=`, `<` and `<=` comparison operators (i.e. `pid = 1`)
- `in` to check inclusion in a list of values (i.e. `pid in (1, 2)` or
`clientipv4 in ("127.0.0.1", "192.168.0.1")`)

This query language does not support the full set of metrics supported
in the monitor query language, but instead supports a set of fields
proper to each audit events type.

These are the supported fields:
- `id`
- `agentid`
- `auditid`
- `clientipv4`
- `clientport`
- `cmdline`
- `comm`
- `command`
- `containerid`
- `count`
- `customerid`
- `cwd`
- `direction`
- `errorcode`
- `l4protocol`
- `loginshell.distance`
- `loginshell.id`
- `name`
- `namespace`
- `pid`
- `ppid`
- `processname`
- `resource`
- `rxtimestamp`
- `serveripv4`
- `serverport`
- `sourceaddresses`
- `stages`
- `status`
- `subresource`
- `timestamp`
- `uid`
- `user`
- `useragent`

parameters.name: types
parameters.description:
The event types to filter. A comma separated list of one or more of 
the following supported values:
  - kubernetes
  - commands
  - connections
  - fileaccesses

total.description:
The number of audit events returned. This number is always less or
equal the limit specified in the request.

prev.description:
The continuation token used to fetch a set of audit events before
the current one.

next.description:
The continuation token used to fetch a set of audit events after the
current one.

id.description: The audit event id.

timestamp.description: Timestamp the audit event occured, expressed in nanoseconds.

rxTimestamp.description: Timestamp the command was received, expressed in nanoseconds.

metrics.description: List of metrics associated to the audit event.

containerId.description:
The container id. `containerId` is present only if the audit event was
collected in a container context.

count.description:
Count of commands. `command` is ever greater than `1` only when
commands are grouped together.

pcomm.description: The name of the parent command.

loginShellDistance.description: Level of nesting from the parent shell.

id.description: The audit event id.

timestamp.description: Timestamp the audit event occured, expressed in nanoseconds.

rxTimestamp.description: Timestamp the command was received, expressed in nanoseconds.

metrics.description: List of metrics associated to the audit event.

containerId.description:
The container id. `containerId` is present only if the audit event was
collected in a container context.

pid.description: Id of the process owning the connection.

processName.description: Name of the process owning the connection.

clientIPv4.description: The IPv4 dotted notation of the client address.

serverIPv4.description: The IPv4 dotted notation of the server address.

status.description: The status of the connection.

id.description: The audit event id.

timestamp.description: Timestamp the audit event occured, expressed in nanoseconds.

rxTimestamp.description: Timestamp the command was received, expressed in nanoseconds.

containerId.description:
The container id. `containerId` is present only if the audit event was
collected in a container context.

pid.description: Id of the process owning the connection.

directory.description: The Directory for the file access.

filename.description: The Filename involved in file access.

permissions.description: The Permissions of the file access.

metrics.description: List of metrics associated to the audit event.

containerId.description:
The container id. `containerId` is present only if the audit event was
collected in a container context.

name.description: The name of the resource.

started.description: The timestamp of the started stage, expressed in nanoseconds

completed.description:
The timestamp of the completed stage, expressed in
nanoseconds

userAgent.description: The user agent of the client

args.description:
Arguments specific for the different types of Kubernetes audit
events. In case of `pods:exec`, `args` will contain the fields
`command` and `container` representing the command called and
the name of the container in the pod where the command was
executed respectively.

get.summary: Retrieves the trace of an audit event
get.description:
Retrieves a trace of all the audit events related to the traceable event
in case it is a long running task. The audit events returned are all the
commands, connections etc collected during the duration of the traceable
event.
If the event has not completed yet, the time range considered is up
until the current time.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The event type.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The audit event id.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results to return.

total.description:
The number of audit events returned. This number is always less or
equal the limit specified in the request.

prev.description:
The continuation token used to fetch a set of audit events before
the current one.

next.description:
The continuation token used to fetch a set of audit events after the
current one.

timestamp.description: Timestamp the audit event occured, expressed in nanoseconds.

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/eventsForwarding/integrations"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"name\":\"Forward to Syslog\",\"type\":\"SYSLOG\",\"enabled\":true,\"channels\":[\"POLICY_EVENTS\"],\"connectionInfo\":{\"ServiceURL\":\"syslog-address\",\"ServicePort\":514}}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request POST \
  --url https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/eventsForwarding/integrations \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"name":"Forward to Syslog","type":"SYSLOG","enabled":true,"channels":["POLICY_EVENTS"],"connectionInfo":{"ServiceURL":"syslog-address","ServicePort":514}}'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.post("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/eventsForwarding/integrations")
  .header("content-type", "application/json")
  .body("{\"name\":\"Forward to Syslog\",\"type\":\"SYSLOG\",\"enabled\":true,\"channels\":[\"POLICY_EVENTS\"],\"connectionInfo\":{\"ServiceURL\":\"syslog-address\",\"ServicePort\":514}}")

headers = { 'content-type': "application/json" }

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("PATCH", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()

	fmt.Println(res)

  --url https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/eventsForwarding/integrations/%7BintegrationId%7D \

get.summary: Get all profiles for a given profileGroupId
get.description: This endpoint returns the profiles for a given profileGroupId

parameters.name: profileGroupId
parameters.description: The id of the profile group

parameters.name: scoreMin
parameters.description: If specified, only profiles with a confidence score at least this amount will be retrieved. Defaults to `0`

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of statuses. If specified, only profiles with these statuses will be retrieved. Defaults to `['FINALIZED','LEARNING']`

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: If specified, filter to only include profiles where the profile name or image name (registry/repository:tag@hash) contains this string. Defaults to empty string

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Field used to sort. Defaults to `score`. Profiles with `status:'FINALIZED'` will always appear above `status:'LEARNING'`, for all values of `sortBy` except `sortBy:'status', sortMethod:'asc'`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: If specified, a limit on the number of entries retrieved. If any filters are also specified, the limit will be applied on the filtered list. `limit` must be >= `1` and if it overflows the list all entries will be retrieved. Defaults to length of list

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: If specified, a 0-based index on the profiles list. Only entries >= `offset` will be retrieved. Defaults to `0`. If any filters are also specified, this index will be applied on the filtered list. An empty list will be retrieved if this index overflows the list.

parameters.name: sortMethod
parameters.description: Sorting method. Defaults to `desc`.

200.description: The profiles for a given profileGroupId

limit.description: The limit used. 0 for no limit.

canLoadMore.description: True if more results can be fetched.

profileId.description: UUID of the profile, based on a SHA of (imageId + profileVersion).

profileName.description: Name of the profile, which includes registry/repository:tag@hash.

profileVersion.description: Version of the profile, incremented when the model is updated.

imageId.description: UUID of the image, based on a SHA256 of the image content.

imageName.description: Name of the image, as registry/repository:tag.

score.description: Value from 0 to 1000 representing the score of the category or subcategory.

status.description: Status of the model (learning or finalized).

subcategories.description: A category has at least one subcategory. Each subcategory refers to one rule and has its own score and status.
subcategories.example: The category `fileSystemProposal` will have an `items` array with subcategories such as "files rw" which refers to a single rule.

name.description: Short description of the subcategory.

ruleName.example: Unexpected spawned process postgres in image a1b2c3d4e5f6
