get.summary: Get profile matching given profileId
get.description: This endpoint returns the profile matching a given profileId

200.description: The profile for a given profileId

profileGroupId.description: Identifier of the related profile group.

id.description: UUID of this profile.

name.description: Name of the profile inside the profileGroup.

profileLifeTracker.description: keep track of the life of an entity

name.description: A short name for the policy

description.example: Monitor all filesystem operations and look for suspicious or notable behavior

severity.description: How severe is this policy when violated. Range from 0 to 7 included.

enabled.description: True if the policy should be considered

scope.description: Where the policy is being applied- Container, Host etc..

ruleNames.description: Array of rule names. (They must be names instead of ids, as the rules list view is by name, to account for multiple rules having the same name).

items.description: Functional behavior that can be enabled within a policy and should be performed if the condition of a policy is met. Certain actions may only make sense for policies of a particular type.

beforeEventNs.description: period of time to capture before event in nanoseconds

afterEventNs.description: period of time to capture after event in nanoseconds

name.description: the name of the file in which the capture will be saved

storageType.description: specifies which strategy will be taken to store the capture

folder.description: the name of an s3 folder (enables the user to specify a bucket that is not in the default bucket root folder '/')

storageId.description: specifies the id of a row in the file_storage table that corresponds to a FileStorageDetails.java object

msg.description: a message to send to the thing being stopped
a message to send to the thing being paused
a message to send to the thing being killed

type.description: A name for a non overlapping subset of policies that share common characteristics. The enums falco and list_matching correspond to the FalcoSource enum syscall, k8s_audit corresponds to k8s_audit, and the others will map to a future enum value once OSS Falco decides a name

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific policy.

version.description: Version of the object. Incremented on each update and used for optimistic locking

createdOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was first created.

modifiedOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was last modified.

origin.description: A string naming the entity that created this rule. This, combined with the version identifier, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. The origin should be "Secure UI" for objects created by the Secure UI, "Sysdig" for objects provided by Sysdig, and "Customer" for objects provided programmatically by the customer.

versionId.description: A string representing the version of the file that contained this rule. This, combined with the origin, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. For rules with origin == Sysdig/Customer, the version identifier should come from the version property of the FalcoRulesFiles object that originally contained the rule. For rules with origin == Secure UI, the version should be a constant string "current".

profileId.description: UUID of the profile, based on a SHA of (imageId + profileVersion).

profileName.description: Name of the profile, which includes registry/repository:tag@hash.

profileVersion.description: Version of the profile, incremented when the model is updated.

imageId.description: UUID of the image, based on a SHA256 of the image content.

imageName.description: Name of the image, as registry/repository:tag.

proposedRules.description: Array of rules referred to by the proposed policy in `proposedPolicy`, that have not yet been created. Each of the `ruleNames` in `proposedPolicy` must refer to a rule's `name` of either a proposed rule in this array or a rule that already exists.

id.description: A unique identifier representing a specific rule

name.description: A name for this object. For Falco rules/macros/lists, should exactly be the value of the "rule"/"macro"/"list" property of the yaml object.

origin.description: A string naming the entity that created this rule. This, combined with the version identifier, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. The origin should be "Secure UI" for objects created by the Secure UI, "Sysdig" for objects provided by Sysdig, and "Customer" for objects provided programmatically by the customer.

versionId.description: A string representing the version of the file that contained this rule. This, combined with the origin, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. For rules with origin == Sysdig/Customer, the version identifier should come from the version property of the FalcoRulesFiles object that originally contained the rule. For rules with origin == Secure UI, the version should be a constant string "current".

filename.description: Name of the file in which the rule is defined. For Default Falco rules, this should come from the name property of the FalcoRulesFile object that contained this rule. For other falco rules, the filename should be "falco_rules.local.yaml". For non-falco rules, the filename should be "fast_rules.local.yaml".

version.description: The version is incremented when the update is successful.

createdOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was first created.

modifiedOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was last modified.

description.description: A description of this rule. No newlines/formatting.
description.example: an attempt to write to any file below a set of binary directories

append.description: If true, this object should be appended to an object with the same name that has already been loaded. Defaults to false if not present.

condition.description: the full condition text exactly as represented in the yaml file
condition.example: evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)

components.description: an array containing the broken-up components of this falco rule\'s condition field

text.description: An opaque hunk of condition text. May contain a mix of fields, relational operators, etc. Basically anything between Macro/List references.

falcoMacroReference.description: The name of a FalcoMacro object. (Intentionally using names instead of ids so it can be passed directly from falco without falco having its own notion of rule/macro/list ids).

falcoListReference.description: The name of a FalcoList object. (Intentionally using names instead of ids so it can be passed directly from falco without falco having its own notion of rule/macro/list ids).

output.description: A string describing the output string to generate when this rule matches an event. Should exactly match the output property of the rule\'s output field
output.example: File below a known binary directory opened for writing (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name)

priority.description: A string describing the falco rule\'s priority. This is only included so the resulting rule can be converted back to yaml easily. For the purposes of policy events, the policy\'s severity should be used instead of this value.

source.description: An event source through which Falco rules are evaluated. The enum syscall corresponds to the policy types falco and list_matching. The enum k8s_audit corresponds to the policy type k8s_audit

allOf.description: Represents a list of items and whether the list represents a set of items to match or not match

items.description: the set of paths/syscalls/ports/etc.

matchItems.description: If true, the rule matches if the path/syscall/port matches one of the items in the list. If false, the rule matches if the path/syscall/port/etc does not match any of the items in the list.

allOf.description: Represents a list of items and whether the list represents a set of items to match or not match

items.description: the set of paths/syscalls/ports/etc.

allOutbound.description: If true, then all outbound connection attempts match this rule

allInbound.description: If true, then all inbound connection attempts match this rule

put.summary: Update a default Falco list

append.description: If true, this object should be appended to an object with the same name that has already been loaded. Defaults to false if not present.

id.description: A unique identifier representing a specific rule

name.description: A name for this object. For Falco rules/macros/lists, should exactly be the value of the "rule"/"macro"/"list" property of the yaml object.

origin.description: A string naming the entity that created this rule. This, combined with the version identifier, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. The origin should be "Secure UI" for objects created by the Secure UI, "Sysdig" for objects provided by Sysdig, and "Customer" for objects provided programmatically by the customer.

versionId.description: A string representing the version of the file that contained this rule. This, combined with the origin, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. For rules with origin == Sysdig/Customer, the version identifier should come from the version property of the FalcoRulesFiles object that originally contained the rule. For rules with origin == Secure UI, the version should be a constant string "current".

filename.description: The name of a Falco rules file

version.description: The version is incremented when the update is successful.

createdOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was first created.

modifiedOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was last modified.

append.description: If true, this object should be appended to an object with the same name that has already been loaded. Defaults to false if not present.

items.description: the array of items as represented in the yaml List
the item text or list name

components.description: an array containing the broken-up components of this falco list\'s items field

text.description: Any sort of text that might make sense to put in a list

falcoListReference.description: The name of a FalcoList object. (Intentionally using names instead of ids so it can be passed directly from falco without falco having its own notion of rule/macro/list ids).

400.description: The provided falco list is not valid

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/settings/falco/lists/%7BlistId%7D"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"items\":[\"/bin/bash\",\"/bin/ksh\"],\"append\":true}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("PUT", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request PUT \
  --url https://secure.sysdig.com/api/settings/falco/lists/%7BlistId%7D \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"items":["/bin/bash","/bin/ksh"],"append":true}'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.put("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/settings/falco/lists/%7BlistId%7D")
  .header("content-type", "application/json")
  .body("{\"items\":[\"/bin/bash\",\"/bin/ksh\"],\"append\":true}")
  .asString();

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("secure.sysdig.com")

payload = "{\"items\":[\"/bin/bash\",\"/bin/ksh\"],\"append\":true}"

headers = { 'content-type': "application/json" }

conn.request("PUT", "/api/settings/falco/lists/%7BlistId%7D", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

get.summary: Get the default falco rules files
get.description: Get the default falco rules files e.g. the set of falco rules managed by sysdig.

version.description: Version of the object. Incremented on each update and used for optimistic locking

tag.description: An externally provided version identifier (e.g. git tag) that can be used to uniquely identify this set of files.

files.description: A list of files that comprise the set of rules files

name.description: A name for this file. Should be used in UI to distinguish between files.

variants.description: An array of alternate versions for the given file. An agent should choose the highest version that is compatible with its included falco engine.

required_engine_version.description: The minimum falco engine version that can read this rules file variant.

content.description: A string containing the yaml contents of a falco rules file variant.

defaultPolicies.description: A list of reference policies that can be created from the provided falco rules. Used by the /v2/policies/default endpoint.

name.description: A short name for the policy

description.example: Monitor all filesystem operations and look for suspicious or notable behavior

severity.description: How severe is this policy when violated. Range from 0 to 7 included.

enabled.description: True if the policy should be considered

scope.description: Where the policy is being applied- Container, Host etc..

ruleNames.description: Array of rule names. (They must be names instead of ids, as the rules list view is by name, to account for multiple rules having the same name).

items.description: Functional behavior that can be enabled within a policy and should be performed if the condition of a policy is met. Certain actions may only make sense for policies of a particular type.

beforeEventNs.description: period of time to capture before event in nanoseconds

afterEventNs.description: period of time to capture after event in nanoseconds

name.description: the name of the file in which the capture will be saved

storageType.description: specifies which strategy will be taken to store the capture

folder.description: the name of an s3 folder (enables the user to specify a bucket that is not in the default bucket root folder '/')

storageId.description: specifies the id of a row in the file_storage table that corresponds to a FileStorageDetails.java object

msg.description: a message to send to the thing being stopped
a message to send to the thing being paused
a message to send to the thing being killed

type.description: A name for a non overlapping subset of policies that share common characteristics. The enums falco and list_matching correspond to the FalcoSource enum syscall, k8s_audit corresponds to k8s_audit, and the others will map to a future enum value once OSS Falco decides a name

put.summary: Set the custom rules files e.g. the set of falco rules managed by a customer.
put.description: Set the current custom falco rules files. This content is always validated by passing the current default rules files plus the submitted customer rules files and any Secure UI generated rules to the open source falco executable to verify that falco can read the combination of files. The backend should choose the variant that has the greatest required_engine_version for each file, and then run open source falco with the -d option to verify the files. As knowing the current value of the `version` field is required to successfully update the rules file, in order to update the rules content you must first do a GET and update the `content` property. The `version` property in the response will be incremented on success.

post.summary: Create a new security policy
post.description: Save a new security policy.

name.description: A short name for the policy

description.example: Monitor all filesystem operations and look for suspicious or notable behavior

severity.description: How severe is this policy when violated. Range from 0 to 7 included.

enabled.description: True if the policy should be considered

scope.description: Where the policy is being applied- Container, Host etc..

ruleNames.description: Array of rule names. (They must be names instead of ids, as the rules list view is by name, to account for multiple rules having the same name).

items.description: Functional behavior that can be enabled within a policy and should be performed if the condition of a policy is met. Certain actions may only make sense for policies of a particular type.

beforeEventNs.description: period of time to capture before event in nanoseconds

afterEventNs.description: period of time to capture after event in nanoseconds

name.description: the name of the file in which the capture will be saved

storageType.description: specifies which strategy will be taken to store the capture

folder.description: the name of an s3 folder (enables the user to specify a bucket that is not in the default bucket root folder '/')

storageId.description: specifies the id of a row in the file_storage table that corresponds to a FileStorageDetails.java object

msg.description: a message to send to the thing being stopped
a message to send to the thing being paused
a message to send to the thing being killed

type.description: A name for a non overlapping subset of policies that share common characteristics. The enums falco and list_matching correspond to the FalcoSource enum syscall, k8s_audit corresponds to k8s_audit, and the others will map to a future enum value once OSS Falco decides a name

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific policy.

version.description: Version of the object. Incremented on each update and used for optimistic locking

templateId.description: id of the template this policy was birthed from.  For unmanaged policies this value is nil

templateVersion.description: version of the template this policy was most recently updated from.

createdOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was first created.

modifiedOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was last modified.

origin.description: A string naming the entity that created this rule. This, combined with the version identifier, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. The origin should be "Secure UI" for objects created by the Secure UI, "Sysdig" for objects provided by Sysdig, and "Customer" for objects provided programmatically by the customer.

versionId.description: A string representing the version of the file that contained this rule. This, combined with the origin, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. For rules with origin == Sysdig/Customer, the version identifier should come from the version property of the FalcoRulesFiles object that originally contained the rule. For rules with origin == Secure UI, the version should be a constant string "current".

profileId.description: UUID of the profile, based on a SHA of (imageId + profileVersion).

profileName.description: Name of the profile, which includes registry/repository:tag@hash.

profileVersion.description: Version of the profile, incremented when the model is updated.

imageId.description: UUID of the image, based on a SHA256 of the image content.

imageName.description: Name of the image, as registry/repository:tag.

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v2/policies"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"name\":\"Check filesystem activity\",\"description\":\"Monitor all filesystem operations and look for suspicious or notable behavior\",\"severity\":4,\"enabled\":true,\"scope\":\"container.image.repository = sysdig/agent\",\"ruleNames\":[\"Write below binary dir\",\"Write below root\",\"Write below monitored dir\"],\"actions\":[{\"type\":\"POLICY_ACTION_CAPTURE\",\"filter\":\"proc.name=cat or proc.name=vi\",\"isLimitedToContainer\":true,\"beforeEventNs\":0,\"afterEventNs\":0,\"name\":\"string\",\"storageType\":\"LOCAL\",\"bucketName\":\"string\",\"folder\":\"string\",\"storageId\":0}],\"type\":\"falco\",\"id\":1,\"version\":18,\"templateId\":2,\"templateVersion\":4,\"isDefault\":true,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"notificationChannelIds\":[[3,5]],\"profile\":{\"profileId\":\"string\",\"profileName\":\"string\",\"profileVersion\":0,\"imageId\":\"string\",\"imageName\":\"string\"}}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

  .asString();

payload = "{\"name\":\"Check filesystem activity\",\"description\":\"Monitor all filesystem operations and look for suspicious or notable behavior\",\"severity\":4,\"enabled\":true,\"scope\":\"container.image.repository = sysdig/agent\",\"ruleNames\":[\"Write below binary dir\",\"Write below root\",\"Write below monitored dir\"],\"actions\":[{\"type\":\"POLICY_ACTION_CAPTURE\",\"filter\":\"proc.name=cat or proc.name=vi\",\"isLimitedToContainer\":true,\"beforeEventNs\":0,\"afterEventNs\":0,\"name\":\"string\",\"storageType\":\"LOCAL\",\"bucketName\":\"string\",\"folder\":\"string\",\"storageId\":0}],\"type\":\"falco\",\"id\":1,\"version\":18,\"templateId\":2,\"templateVersion\":4,\"isDefault\":true,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"notificationChannelIds\":[[3,5]],\"profile\":{\"profileId\":\"string\",\"profileName\":\"string\",\"profileVersion\":0,\"imageId\":\"string\",\"imageName\":\"string\"}}"

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v2/policies/%7Bid%7D"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"name\":\"Check filesystem activity\",\"description\":\"Monitor all filesystem operations and look for suspicious or notable behavior\",\"severity\":4,\"enabled\":true,\"scope\":\"container.image.repository = sysdig/agent\",\"ruleNames\":[\"Write below binary dir\",\"Write below root\",\"Write below monitored dir\"],\"actions\":[{\"type\":\"POLICY_ACTION_CAPTURE\",\"filter\":\"proc.name=cat or proc.name=vi\",\"isLimitedToContainer\":true,\"beforeEventNs\":0,\"afterEventNs\":0,\"name\":\"string\",\"storageType\":\"LOCAL\",\"bucketName\":\"string\",\"folder\":\"string\",\"storageId\":0}],\"type\":\"falco\",\"id\":1,\"version\":18,\"templateId\":2,\"templateVersion\":4,\"isDefault\":true,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"notificationChannelIds\":[[3,5]],\"profile\":{\"profileId\":\"string\",\"profileName\":\"string\",\"profileVersion\":0,\"imageId\":\"string\",\"imageName\":\"string\"}}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("PUT", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v2/policies/batch"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"policy\":{\"name\":\"Check filesystem activity\",\"description\":\"Monitor all filesystem operations and look for suspicious or notable behavior\",\"severity\":4,\"enabled\":true,\"scope\":\"container.image.repository = sysdig/agent\",\"ruleNames\":[\"Write below binary dir\",\"Write below root\",\"Write below monitored dir\"],\"actions\":[{\"type\":\"POLICY_ACTION_CAPTURE\",\"filter\":\"proc.name=cat or proc.name=vi\",\"isLimitedToContainer\":true,\"beforeEventNs\":0,\"afterEventNs\":0,\"name\":\"string\",\"storageType\":\"LOCAL\",\"bucketName\":\"string\",\"folder\":\"string\",\"storageId\":0}],\"type\":\"falco\",\"id\":1,\"version\":18,\"templateId\":2,\"templateVersion\":4,\"isDefault\":true,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"notificationChannelIds\":[[3,5]],\"profile\":{\"profileId\":\"string\",\"profileName\":\"string\",\"profileVersion\":0,\"imageId\":\"string\",\"imageName\":\"string\"}},\"rules\":[{\"id\":1,\"name\":\"Write Below Binary Dir\",\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"filename\":\"falco_rules_local.yaml\",\"version\":5,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"tags\":[\"Kubernetes\",\"CIS Compliance\",\"File Integrity\"],\"description\":\"an attempt to write to any file below a set of binary directories\",\"details\":{\"append\":\"true\",\"ruleType\":\"FALCO\",\"condition\":{\"condition\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)\",\"components\":[{\"text\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and \"}]},\"output\":\"File below a known binary directory opened for writing (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name)\",\"priority\":\"error\",\"source\":\"syscall\"}}]}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

post.summary: Create a new rule
post.description: Save a new rule

id.description: A unique identifier representing a specific rule

name.description: A name for this object. For Falco rules/macros/lists, should exactly be the value of the "rule"/"macro"/"list" property of the yaml object.

origin.description: A string naming the entity that created this rule. This, combined with the version identifier, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. The origin should be "Secure UI" for objects created by the Secure UI, "Sysdig" for objects provided by Sysdig, and "Customer" for objects provided programmatically by the customer.

versionId.description: A string representing the version of the file that contained this rule. This, combined with the origin, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. For rules with origin == Sysdig/Customer, the version identifier should come from the version property of the FalcoRulesFiles object that originally contained the rule. For rules with origin == Secure UI, the version should be a constant string "current".

filename.description: The name of a Falco rules file

version.description: The version is incremented when the update is successful.

createdOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was first created.

modifiedOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was last modified.

description.description: A description of this rule. No newlines/formatting.
description.example: an attempt to write to any file below a set of binary directories

append.description: If true, this object should be appended to an object with the same name that has already been loaded. Defaults to false if not present.

condition.description: the full condition text exactly as represented in the yaml file
condition.example: evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)

components.description: an array containing the broken-up components of this falco rule\'s condition field

text.description: An opaque hunk of condition text. May contain a mix of fields, relational operators, etc. Basically anything between Macro/List references.

falcoMacroReference.description: The name of a FalcoMacro object. (Intentionally using names instead of ids so it can be passed directly from falco without falco having its own notion of rule/macro/list ids).

falcoListReference.description: The name of a FalcoList object. (Intentionally using names instead of ids so it can be passed directly from falco without falco having its own notion of rule/macro/list ids).

output.description: A string describing the output string to generate when this rule matches an event. Should exactly match the output property of the rule\'s output field
output.example: File below a known binary directory opened for writing (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name)

priority.description: A string describing the falco rule\'s priority. This is only included so the resulting rule can be converted back to yaml easily. For the purposes of policy events, the policy\'s severity should be used instead of this value.

source.description: An event source through which Falco rules are evaluated. The enum syscall corresponds to the policy types falco and list_matching. The enum k8s_audit corresponds to the policy type k8s_audit

allOf.description: Represents a list of items and whether the list represents a set of items to match or not match

items.description: the set of paths/syscalls/ports/etc.

matchItems.description: If true, the rule matches if the path/syscall/port matches one of the items in the list. If false, the rule matches if the path/syscall/port/etc does not match any of the items in the list.

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/secure/rules"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"id\":1,\"name\":\"Write Below Binary Dir\",\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"filename\":\"falco_rules_local.yaml\",\"version\":5,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"tags\":[\"Kubernetes\",\"CIS Compliance\",\"File Integrity\"],\"description\":\"an attempt to write to any file below a set of binary directories\",\"details\":{\"append\":\"true\",\"ruleType\":\"FALCO\",\"condition\":{\"condition\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)\",\"components\":[{\"text\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and \"}]},\"output\":\"File below a known binary directory opened for writing (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name)\",\"priority\":\"error\",\"source\":\"syscall\"}}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request POST \
  --url https://secure.sysdig.com/api/secure/rules \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"id":1,"name":"Write Below Binary Dir","origin":"Secure UI","versionId":"v1.2.3","filename":"falco_rules_local.yaml","version":5,"createdOn":1553702727177,"modifiedOn":1553702738288,"tags":["Kubernetes","CIS Compliance","File Integrity"],"description":"an attempt to write to any file below a set of binary directories","details":{"append":"true","ruleType":"FALCO","condition":{"condition":"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)","components":[{"text":"evt.type in (open, openat) and "}]},"output":"File below a known binary directory opened for writing (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name)","priority":"error","source":"syscall"}}'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.post("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/secure/rules")
  .header("content-type", "application/json")
  .body("{\"id\":1,\"name\":\"Write Below Binary Dir\",\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"filename\":\"falco_rules_local.yaml\",\"version\":5,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"tags\":[\"Kubernetes\",\"CIS Compliance\",\"File Integrity\"],\"description\":\"an attempt to write to any file below a set of binary directories\",\"details\":{\"append\":\"true\",\"ruleType\":\"FALCO\",\"condition\":{\"condition\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)\",\"components\":[{\"text\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and \"}]},\"output\":\"File below a known binary directory opened for writing (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name)\",\"priority\":\"error\",\"source\":\"syscall\"}}")
  .asString();

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("secure.sysdig.com")

payload = "{\"id\":1,\"name\":\"Write Below Binary Dir\",\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"filename\":\"falco_rules_local.yaml\",\"version\":5,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"tags\":[\"Kubernetes\",\"CIS Compliance\",\"File Integrity\"],\"description\":\"an attempt to write to any file below a set of binary directories\",\"details\":{\"append\":\"true\",\"ruleType\":\"FALCO\",\"condition\":{\"condition\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)\",\"components\":[{\"text\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and \"}]},\"output\":\"File below a known binary directory opened for writing (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name)\",\"priority\":\"error\",\"source\":\"syscall\"}}"

headers = { 'content-type': "application/json" }

conn.request("POST", "/api/secure/rules", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/secure/rules/%7BruleId%7D"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"id\":1,\"name\":\"Write Below Binary Dir\",\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"filename\":\"falco_rules_local.yaml\",\"version\":5,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"tags\":[\"Kubernetes\",\"CIS Compliance\",\"File Integrity\"],\"description\":\"an attempt to write to any file below a set of binary directories\",\"details\":{\"append\":\"true\",\"ruleType\":\"FALCO\",\"condition\":{\"condition\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)\",\"components\":[{\"text\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and \"}]},\"output\":\"File below a known binary directory opened for writing (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name)\",\"priority\":\"error\",\"source\":\"syscall\"}}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("PUT", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request PUT \
  --url https://secure.sysdig.com/api/secure/rules/%7BruleId%7D \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"id":1,"name":"Write Below Binary Dir","origin":"Secure UI","versionId":"v1.2.3","filename":"falco_rules_local.yaml","version":5,"createdOn":1553702727177,"modifiedOn":1553702738288,"tags":["Kubernetes","CIS Compliance","File Integrity"],"description":"an attempt to write to any file below a set of binary directories","details":{"append":"true","ruleType":"FALCO","condition":{"condition":"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)","components":[{"text":"evt.type in (open, openat) and "}]},"output":"File below a known binary directory opened for writing (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name)","priority":"error","source":"syscall"}}'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.put("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/secure/rules/%7BruleId%7D")
  .header("content-type", "application/json")
  .body("{\"id\":1,\"name\":\"Write Below Binary Dir\",\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"filename\":\"falco_rules_local.yaml\",\"version\":5,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"tags\":[\"Kubernetes\",\"CIS Compliance\",\"File Integrity\"],\"description\":\"an attempt to write to any file below a set of binary directories\",\"details\":{\"append\":\"true\",\"ruleType\":\"FALCO\",\"condition\":{\"condition\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)\",\"components\":[{\"text\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and \"}]},\"output\":\"File below a known binary directory opened for writing (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name)\",\"priority\":\"error\",\"source\":\"syscall\"}}")
  .asString();

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("secure.sysdig.com")

payload = "{\"id\":1,\"name\":\"Write Below Binary Dir\",\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"filename\":\"falco_rules_local.yaml\",\"version\":5,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"tags\":[\"Kubernetes\",\"CIS Compliance\",\"File Integrity\"],\"description\":\"an attempt to write to any file below a set of binary directories\",\"details\":{\"append\":\"true\",\"ruleType\":\"FALCO\",\"condition\":{\"condition\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)\",\"components\":[{\"text\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and \"}]},\"output\":\"File below a known binary directory opened for writing (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name)\",\"priority\":\"error\",\"source\":\"syscall\"}}"

headers = { 'content-type': "application/json" }

conn.request("PUT", "/api/secure/rules/%7BruleId%7D", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

get.summary: Retrieve a list of summary rule information, grouped by rule name
get.description: Returns the list of rules in the system. These are grouped by name and do not necessarily represent individual rule objects, as multiple rules can have the same name.

schema.description: A name for a non overlapping subset of policies that share common characteristics. The enums falco and list_matching correspond to the FalcoSource enum syscall, k8s_audit corresponds to k8s_audit, and the others will map to a future enum value once OSS Falco decides a name

200.description: An array of rules grouped by name.

ids.description: The specific object ids having this name

name.description: A name for this object. For Falco rules/macros/lists, should exactly be the value of the "rule"/"macro"/"list" property of the yaml object.

origin.description: A string naming the entity that created this rule. This, combined with the version identifier, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. The origin should be "Secure UI" for objects created by the Secure UI, "Sysdig" for objects provided by Sysdig, and "Customer" for objects provided programmatically by the customer.

versionId.description: A string representing the version of the file that contained this rule. This, combined with the origin, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. For rules with origin == Sysdig/Customer, the version identifier should come from the version property of the FalcoRulesFiles object that originally contained the rule. For rules with origin == Secure UI, the version should be a constant string "current".

publishedBys.description: A set of (origin,versionId) pairs for all the objects sharing this name.

modifiedOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was last modified.

usedCount.description: The number of rules that refer to this object (macro/list) OR the number of policies that refer to this rule

falcoListReference.description: The name of a FalcoList object. (Intentionally using names instead of ids so it can be passed directly from falco without falco having its own notion of rule/macro/list ids).

output.description: A string describing the output string to generate when this rule matches an event. Should exactly match the output property of the rule\'s output field

priority.description: A string describing the falco rule\'s priority. This is only included so the resulting rule can be converted back to yaml easily. For the purposes of policy events, the policy\'s severity should be used instead of this value.

source.description: An event source through which Falco rules are evaluated. The enum syscall corresponds to the policy types falco and list_matching. The enum k8s_audit corresponds to the policy type k8s_audit

allOf.description: Represents a list of items and whether the list represents a set of items to match or not match

items.description: the set of paths/syscalls/ports/etc.

matchItems.description: If true, the rule matches if the path/syscall/port matches one of the items in the list. If false, the rule matches if the path/syscall/port/etc does not match any of the items in the list.

get.summary: Retrieve a map of rule names to their corresponding policies that use them
get.description: Retrieve a map of rule names to their corresponding policies that use them. The accept header will include "lite" to indicate the lightweight response of the endpoint should be returned e.g. 'application/xhtml+xml; lite' and return the full representation if not requested

schema.description: A string naming the entity that created this rule. This, combined with the version identifier, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. The origin should be "Secure UI" for objects created by the Secure UI, "Sysdig" for objects provided by Sysdig, and "Customer" for objects provided programmatically by the customer.

rule.description: the name of a runtime policy rule

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific policy.

name.description: A short name for the policy

enabled.description: True if the policy should be considered

rule.description: the name of a runtime policy rule

name.description: A short name for the policy

description.example: Monitor all filesystem operations and look for suspicious or notable behavior

severity.description: How severe is this policy when violated. Range from 0 to 7 included.

enabled.description: True if the policy should be considered

scope.description: Where the policy is being applied- Container, Host etc..

ruleNames.description: Array of rule names. (They must be names instead of ids, as the rules list view is by name, to account for multiple rules having the same name).

items.description: Functional behavior that can be enabled within a policy and should be performed if the condition of a policy is met. Certain actions may only make sense for policies of a particular type.

beforeEventNs.description: period of time to capture before event in nanoseconds

afterEventNs.description: period of time to capture after event in nanoseconds

name.description: the name of the file in which the capture will be saved

storageType.description: specifies which strategy will be taken to store the capture

folder.description: the name of an s3 folder (enables the user to specify a bucket that is not in the default bucket root folder '/')

storageId.description: specifies the id of a row in the file_storage table that corresponds to a FileStorageDetails.java object

msg.description: a message to send to the thing being stopped
a message to send to the thing being paused
a message to send to the thing being killed

type.description: A name for a non overlapping subset of policies that share common characteristics. The enums falco and list_matching correspond to the FalcoSource enum syscall, k8s_audit corresponds to k8s_audit, and the others will map to a future enum value once OSS Falco decides a name

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific policy.

version.description: Version of the object. Incremented on each update and used for optimistic locking

templateId.description: id of the template this policy was birthed from.  For unmanaged policies this value is nil

templateVersion.description: version of the template this policy was most recently updated from.

createdOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was first created.

modifiedOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was last modified.

origin.description: A string naming the entity that created this rule. This, combined with the version identifier, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. The origin should be "Secure UI" for objects created by the Secure UI, "Sysdig" for objects provided by Sysdig, and "Customer" for objects provided programmatically by the customer.

versionId.description: A string representing the version of the file that contained this rule. This, combined with the origin, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. For rules with origin == Sysdig/Customer, the version identifier should come from the version property of the FalcoRulesFiles object that originally contained the rule. For rules with origin == Secure UI, the version should be a constant string "current".

profileId.description: UUID of the profile, based on a SHA of (imageId + profileVersion).

profileName.description: Name of the profile, which includes registry/repository:tag@hash.

profileVersion.description: Version of the profile, incremented when the model is updated.

imageId.description: UUID of the image, based on a SHA256 of the image content.

imageName.description: Name of the image, as registry/repository:tag.

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/secure/falco/macros"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"id\":1,\"name\":\"Write Below Binary Dir\",\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"filename\":\"falco_rules_local.yaml\",\"version\":5,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"append\":\"true\",\"condition\":{\"condition\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)\",\"components\":[{\"text\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and \"}]}}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request POST \
  --url https://secure.sysdig.com/api/secure/falco/macros \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"id":1,"name":"Write Below Binary Dir","origin":"Secure UI","versionId":"v1.2.3","filename":"falco_rules_local.yaml","version":5,"createdOn":1553702727177,"modifiedOn":1553702738288,"append":"true","condition":{"condition":"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)","components":[{"text":"evt.type in (open, openat) and "}]}}'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.post("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/secure/falco/macros")
  .header("content-type", "application/json")
  .body("{\"id\":1,\"name\":\"Write Below Binary Dir\",\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"filename\":\"falco_rules_local.yaml\",\"version\":5,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"append\":\"true\",\"condition\":{\"condition\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)\",\"components\":[{\"text\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and \"}]}}")
  .asString();

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("secure.sysdig.com")

payload = "{\"id\":1,\"name\":\"Write Below Binary Dir\",\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"filename\":\"falco_rules_local.yaml\",\"version\":5,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"append\":\"true\",\"condition\":{\"condition\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and bin_dir and fd.name in (monitored_directories)\",\"components\":[{\"text\":\"evt.type in (open, openat) and \"}]}}"

headers = { 'content-type': "application/json" }

conn.request("POST", "/api/secure/falco/macros", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

For rules with origin == Secure UI, the version should be a constant string "current".

usedCount.description: The number of rules that refer to this object (macro/list) OR the number of policies that refer to this rule

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/secure/falco/lists"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"id\":1,\"name\":\"Write Below Binary Dir\",\"origin\":\"Secure UI\",\"versionId\":\"v1.2.3\",\"filename\":\"falco_rules_local.yaml\",\"version\":5,\"createdOn\":1553702727177,\"modifiedOn\":1553702738288,\"append\":\"true\",\"items\":{\"items\":[\"bash\",\"\\\"sh -c node -e \\\\\\\"require('nan')\\\\\\\"\\\"\",\"monitored_directories\"],\"components\":[{\"text\":\"item 1\"}]}}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

get.summary: Retrieve a list of summary falco list information, grouped by list name
get.description: Returns the list of falco lists in the system. These are grouped by name and do not necessarily represent individual falco list objects, as multiple falco lists can have the same name.

200.description: An array of falco lists grouped by name.

ids.description: The specific object ids having this name

name.description: A name for this object. For Falco rules/macros/lists, should exactly be the value of the "rule"/"macro"/"list" property of the yaml object.

origin.description: A string naming the entity that created this rule. This, combined with the version identifier, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. The origin should be "Secure UI" for objects created by the Secure UI, "Sysdig" for objects provided by Sysdig, and "Customer" for objects provided programmatically by the customer.

versionId.description: A string representing the version of the file that contained this rule. This, combined with the origin, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. For rules with origin == Sysdig/Customer, the version identifier should come from the version property of the FalcoRulesFiles object that originally contained the rule. For rules with origin == Secure UI, the version should be a constant string "current".

publishedBys.description: A set of (origin,versionId) pairs for all the objects sharing this name.

modifiedOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was last modified.

usedCount.description: The number of rules that refer to this object (macro/list) OR the number of policies that refer to this rule

get.summary: Retrieve a group of falco lists having a given name
get.description: Retrieve a group of all falco lists having the given name. This is used to show how a base list is modified by later lists that override/append to the list.

id.description: A unique identifier representing a specific rule

name.description: A name for this object. For Falco rules/macros/lists, should exactly be the value of the "rule"/"macro"/"list" property of the yaml object.

origin.description: A string naming the entity that created this rule. This, combined with the version identifier, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. The origin should be "Secure UI" for objects created by the Secure UI, "Sysdig" for objects provided by Sysdig, and "Customer" for objects provided programmatically by the customer.

versionId.description: A string representing the version of the file that contained this rule. This, combined with the origin, corresponds to the "Published by" field in the UI. For rules with origin == Sysdig/Customer, the version identifier should come from the version property of the FalcoRulesFiles object that originally contained the rule. For rules with origin == Secure UI, the version should be a constant string "current".

filename.description: The name of a Falco rules file

version.description: The version is incremented when the update is successful.

createdOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was first created.

modifiedOn.description: A timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the rules object was last modified.

append.description: If true, this object should be appended to an object with the same name that has already been loaded. Defaults to false if not present.

items.description: the array of items as represented in the yaml List
the item text or list name

components.description: an array containing the broken-up components of this falco list\'s items field

text.description: Any sort of text that might make sense to put in a list

falcoListReference.description: The name of a FalcoList object. (Intentionally using names instead of ids so it can be passed directly from falco without falco having its own notion of rule/macro/list ids).

get.summary: View the available falco filters for a customer
get.description: Returns what falco filters are available to customer to configure falco rules

parameters.name: eventSource

schema.description: An event source through which Falco rules are evaluated. The enum syscall corresponds to the policy types falco and list_matching. The enum k8s_audit corresponds to the policy type k8s_audit

parameters.description: when provided only falco filters corresponding to the specified event source will be included in the response

200.description: The falco filters available to customer to configure falco rules

name.description: Indicates what the falco filter is called

description.description: Provides additional context about the filter such as when it evaluates to true or false and the range of potential evaluation values
description.example: The container's health check. Will be the null value if no healthcheck configured, NONE if configured but explicitly not created, and the healthcheck command line otherwise

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The timestamp in seconds in which the events to be excluded end

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of suggested exclusion proposals to return in the responses. The request will be rejected if it is greater than 10 or less than 1.

200.description: Indicates the service was able to successfully find a list of exceptions to exclude the provided events

400.description: Returned if the start param occurs after the end or if the parameters are of the wrong data type or the limit is out of range

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/secure/policyTuner/exceptions"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"exclusionProposals\":[{\"ruleName\":\"string\",\"exception\":{\"name\":\"string\",\"fields\":{\"stringlist\":[\"string\"],\"string\":\"string\"},\"comps\":{\"stringlist\":[\"string\"],\"string\":\"string\"},\"values\":{\"strings\":[\"string\"],\"tuples\":[{\"items\":[{\"stringlist\":[\"string\"],\"string\":\"string\"}]}]}},\"eventCount\":0}],\"totalEvents\":0}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request POST \
  --url https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/secure/policyTuner/exceptions \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"exclusionProposals":[{"ruleName":"string","exception":{"name":"string","fields":{"stringlist":["string"],"string":"string"},"comps":{"stringlist":["string"],"string":"string"},"values":{"strings":["string"],"tuples":[{"items":[{"stringlist":["string"],"string":"string"}]}]}},"eventCount":0}],"totalEvents":0}'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.post("https://secure.sysdig.com/api/v1/secure/policyTuner/exceptions")
  .header("content-type", "application/json")
  .body("{\"exclusionProposals\":[{\"ruleName\":\"string\",\"exception\":{\"name\":\"string\",\"fields\":{\"stringlist\":[\"string\"],\"string\":\"string\"},\"comps\":{\"stringlist\":[\"string\"],\"string\":\"string\"},\"values\":{\"strings\":[\"string\"],\"tuples\":[{\"items\":[{\"stringlist\":[\"string\"],\"string\":\"string\"}]}]}},\"eventCount\":0}],\"totalEvents\":0}")
  .asString();

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("secure.sysdig.com")

payload = "{\"exclusionProposals\":[{\"ruleName\":\"string\",\"exception\":{\"name\":\"string\",\"fields\":{\"stringlist\":[\"string\"],\"string\":\"string\"},\"comps\":{\"stringlist\":[\"string\"],\"string\":\"string\"},\"values\":{\"strings\":[\"string\"],\"tuples\":[{\"items\":[{\"stringlist\":[\"string\"],\"string\":\"string\"}]}]}},\"eventCount\":0}],\"totalEvents\":0}"

headers = { 'content-type': "application/json" }
